data.title: Oracle Division Application Manager
data.meta_description: Title: Oracle Division Application Manager. City: Houston. State: Texas
data.text:
With more than 120 operations and approximately 20,000 employees worldwide, Precision Castparts Corp. is the market leader in manufacturing large, complex structural investment castings, airfoil castings, forged components, aerostructures and highly engineered, critical fasteners for aerospace applications. In addition, we are the leading producer of airfoil castings for the industrial gas turbine market. We also manufacture extruded seamless pipe, fittings, and forgings for power generation and oil & gas applications; commercial and military airframe aerostructures; and metal alloys and other materials for the casting and forging industries. With such critical applications, we insist on quality and dependability – not just in the materials and products we make, but in the people we recruit.

PCC is relentless in its dedication to being a high-quality, low-cost and on-time producer; delivering the highest value to its customers while continually pursuing strategic, profitable growth.

In 2016, Berkshire Hathaway, led by Chairman and CEO Warren E. Buffett, acquired Precision Castparts Corp.

Job Summary

We currently looking for an Oracle Applications Manager with a minimum of 10 years’ experience. This is a direct opportunity within the Aerospace industry.

Responsible for guiding the tactical decisions of the Oracle ERP system and mentoring the group using strong leadership skills and hands on instruction. Must manage vendor relationships and ensure that technology projects stay on budget and on time. Weekly incident reviews and daily change management coordination is required to conform to our ITIL based environment.

Provide leadership to drive the planning, design, development, implementation, and support of technology solutions using the Oracle E-Business Suite of products. This includes collaborating with other leadership to identify and deliver the appropriate technology solutions in support of strategic company objectives. Also responsible for maintaining the IT business relationship for key business functions. These areas include Finance, Accounting, Supply Chain, Inventory, Quality, and manufacturing operations. This individual will work with the senior managers to identify, prioritize, manage, and deliver the approved IT project portfolio to realize business objectives. This individual will apply proven management, communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of Oracle and IT systems investments.

Skills and Abilities

Significant experience with Oracle E-Business Suite

Specific knowledge of Finance, Accounting, Inventory Management, Supply Chain, and processes in a Manufacturing environment

Experience in leading and mentoring a team and working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

Proven experience in overseeing the direction, development, and implementation of software solutions.

Expected to lead and direct the work of others.

Expected to manage and lead projects. Possess the understanding and have experience in project management and related methodologies is preferred.

Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies.

Flexible and adaptable about learning and understanding new technologies.

Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization

Excellent interpersonal skills.

Ability to conduct research into software-related issues and products.

Technically aware. (SQL, PL/SQL, XML, Apex, Forms/Reports, ORDS/Web Services)

Manage relationships with key stakeholders

Delegate work and conduct timely performance reviews and provide performance feedback/training

Manage and supervise a team of technology professionals through all phases of the technology lifecycle, including requirements assessment, design, development and testing

Perform analyst activities on an as-needed basis

Perform development activities on an as-needed basis

Manage vendor relationships including new software acquisitions, contracts and maintenance renewals

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree and/or a minimum of 15 years of related work experience

10+ years of experience working with Oracle ERP applications. Progression of experience as a Technical Lead or Functional Lead, with at least 5 years spent in a managerial and IT/business role

Minimum of 5+ years of project management, business analyst with deep knowledge on project management methodologies

Multiple full cycle implementations of Oracle EBS Applications implementation experience

Proven track record in leading the development teams and business analyst teams for Oracle applications

Demonstrated use of Oracle methodologies such as OUM or AIM

Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, and technical writing skills

Proven Oracle experience working with RICEW objects in either a managerial, functional or technical capacity
